title: Average hours spent watching TV weekly in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2015
summary: This is a line chart with an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Share of respondents, containing a total of 5 data points.
In general Share of respondents has rose over the Year.
Share of respondents is roughly constant from 11_to_20_hours to I_don't_watch_TV, and lastly slightly increasing from I_don't_watch_TV to More_than_20_hours.

The line significantly remained stable by 22.0 from Year 11_to_20_hours to 5_hours_or_less,remained stable by 9.0 from Year 5_hours_or_less to 6_to_10_hours,remained stable by 16.0 from Year 6_to_10_hours to I_don't_watch_TV, and lastly, increased by 37.0 from Year I_don't_watch_TV to More_than_20_hours.
The most drastic increase took place within the Year I_don't_watch_TV and More_than_20_hours.
Maximum Share of respondents, about 39.0 was reported at Year More_than_20_hours
Minimum Share of respondents about 2.0 was reached at Year I_don't_watch_TV
